alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 28 at 6:51AM HST until January 28 at 10:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Maui in Maui County * Until 1000 AM HST. * At 651 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over west Maui, and over parts of windward Haleakala, especially near Pauwela. Additional heavy showers and thunderstorms are re-developing just offshore, and will move in from the east through mid-morning. Rain was falling at a rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour in the heaviest showers, and flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the entire island of Maui. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1000 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
